comment: He is a great teacher. I had statics online and strength of material in person with him. I enjoyed both of them. He push you through learning the materials and always available in office hours. I recommend him if you would like to deeply learn these subjects and not only for a grade!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Proffessor Kuemmerle may be fine in person, (the few video lectures ive had time to watch were good), but DO NOT TAKE HIS STATICS ONLINE. Considering statics isn't one of the harder engineering classes it's insane that it is taking up 2 or 3 times as much of my focus as the rest of my classes combined. A weeks homework can be ~300+ questions/parts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: Kuemmerle provides examples and real life applications of the content to make sure you fully understand the material. Overall, you have 7 tests, 1 is dropped, weekly discussion posts/ paper hw which were pretty easy to do. Hw is light but the deadline can sneak up on you. Take kuemmerle if you want to actually learn the material

He presents the course material & what's expected of the students extremely clearly, obviously has a firm grasp on the material & communicates it well to the students, & has a great sense of humor throughout lectures/demonstrations. By no means an easy A, but you will be graded fairly & gain a deep understanding. Take Kuemmerle any chance you get.
Professor K. made this class very fun and interesting. I would HIGHLY recommend him to any other student!

Kuemmerle is great! He uses Mastering and gives you access to Study Pack which is helpful when studying for exams. You can tell he wants you to succeed. If you fall behind good luck because he covers a lot. There is no way around Statics but to practice problems. His quizzes seem easy at first but r mostly concept-based so don't overthink them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: He is a cool dude that wish nothing but the best for you. He does post his test on Chegg to catch cheaters. His assignments are due on Wednesday for Hw and Thursday is quiz day. You need to start early because these assignments will sneak up on you due to them being in the middle of the week. He does have you make videos for some assignments.

He is a nice professor. But I think he takes everything seriously and heavy grader. He will deduct points for grammar errors. My English professor wasn't that stick about that grammar. He will also deduct points for typing or formalities on the paper. A lot of quizzes. If you want to put a lot of effort and want to learn definitely he is your guy.
great

Prof. Kuemmerle is a solid choice for statics. His quizzes are quite difficult sometimes if you do not study enough, but the grading scheme overall is very fair, and there is a lot of homework to practice with. He also has videos on just about every topic in statics, which is a great resource.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Overall he is a good professor. The online quizzes he gives are all or nothing, so you do not get any partial credit. But the homework he gives makes up a big portion of your final grade, so even if you do poorly on the quizzes you can still get a good grade in the class. He also curves the quizzes and final exam. Long story short, DO THE HOMEWORK!
He gave reasonable amount of HW and tests after each module. I really enjoyed his class.

Had this teacher online twice. I had a B all semester & the last section he hit it hard and I dropped to a C. The 1st time his testing and grading was different than the 2nd time. While he does curve and give extra credit, be prepared to more than the normal hours in study, homework & class, especially when taking online & still may not pass.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Difficult work of course but he explains everything in lectures very well and goes at a good pace. This is a good course to take online and still be ok.
Prof. Daniel was great, I took his stats class online and it was awesome. A lot of opportunities to get a better grade due to the Hw assignments. Highly recommend

Professor K is a well respected professor. He cares about your grade and is quick to email back. If something messes up or if you have a question about the test/homework, he's gentle with his responses and is fair about assessing you. This course is only hard if you don't put in the effort. Learn from the homework and you'll do just fine.

Terrible professor. Maybe good for upper level (Ive heard) but for statics do yourself a favor and stay away. Gives you pointless lectures that have no relation to the test, doesnt give you any indication of what to study at all. He prepares you horribly. If the class average on tests Doesnt have a passing grade that should speak for itself.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Best Professor for strength and material!!! He is EXCELLENT at teaching his material. His class does have a lot of homework, which will prepare you for his test.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Great lectures with attention to detail. Gradual, deliberate approach to new material - good for those that aren't that solid on physics to begin with. Great sense of humor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Amazing lectures

comment: This is my second time taking Kuemmerle once in statics and now Strength of Materials and hes been great for both. Good lectures and phenomenal partial credit on tests. 2 exams,  6 quizzes, hand written homework, Mastering homework online and a cumulative final. I was able to pull an A in this class but it was certainly a tough course. Study hard

Took him for online stat. The homework wasn't too bad. His discussions on the other hand, good luck with those. Grades very hard on those. Also kind of has an attitude. On top of that, his final is really hard, and doesn't really resemble the practice exam he provides. I would save the extra money you pay for online courses and just take in class.

Professor Kuemmerle is honestly one of the best in the department. He uses the online textbook so half the hw comes from there. There are a lot of quizzes, HWs and online assignments so remember to stay on top of those and you should also be ready for his tests. He's hilarious and really cares about his students. Def would reccomend

Took this professor for Statics online so is was easy. However, many times I emailed him a question he would respond with an obvious smart remark and tell me to look back at slides or check the syllabus. Aside from that it was a fine online course, he obviously put in work to outline the material but can be a tad snarky at times.

Strength of Materials is naturally a difficult class, but Prof. Kuemmerle does everything that he can to drill the material into your head, because this class is incredibly useful. If you come to him with questions, he's always willing to help and it shows him that you're working for knowledge, not just a grade. It's a lot of work but its necessary

Took Kuemmerle for statics and I wouldnt hesitate to take him again. He lectures well and if you put in effort outside class practicing you can do well. The textbook is what I used to study most often. 3 tests, cumulative final, 4 quizzes lowest dropped, and homework. He gives phenomenal partial credit on tests. An A is doable, great professor.

While taking his class I had wished he did more worked problems, but after taking the final and reflecting on whats Ive learned, I think his lectures were way more useful. What he teaches cant be found in a textbook, he really wants you to understand the code and not just how to use the equations but how to think about design

Statics kicked my butt. I did not finish one test on time all semester. In fact, most of the class was still there at the end of the tests. HOWEVER, if you go to him when you are having difficulty, he will make you work hard to receive extra credit, but he will work with you. He is a great professor, I would recommend him, but PRACTICE before test

THE Best.  Prof Kuemmerle actually demonstrates the theory and proves it to you before the computations begin. Problems are worked out in class and grading is fair; if you have questions after the test, he works them all out for you. He increased my knowledge and understanding of materials, and paved a strong foundation for the rest of my courses.

best teacher here. even if you do not have him anymore, he is more than willing to help you with you other classes. there is no-one else here like him, gives lots of partial credit, and can actually teach.

All around great professor. He gives lots of examples and explains the material clearly. He worked in the field before teaching so he know what he is talking about. Classes are application based and he is always will to go over material again if students don't understand. Grades fairly, gives partial credit. Take this prof if you get the chance!!!

Great professor. I do not care for structures at all and I had structural analysis with this prof and I would take advance structural analysis if he taught it. His lectures are great and he really explains the subjects well and gives lots of examples. I absolutely love this prof and would take anything he taught

I suck at structures, but with him I was able to learn. I took notes and did the homework, learned from my quiz mistakes (quizzes are hard) and managed to do well. He gives a lot of partial credit and the easiest test is the final. Put forth some effort and you will pass
Great Professor for fluid dynamics, the class itself was very hard and fast paced. Test were very hard but grading was very fair.
Awesome teacher, he really cares and is more than willing to spend extra time to explain things.
Took him for SOM. Great teacher, wish I could have taken him for fluids instead of Beadle-juice.
Great professor. Goes over problems in class. Tests are fair. Down to earth and funny.

I would DEFINITELY take him for fluid mechanics if I were you. Great, down to earth guy. Easy to understand. If you do your work, and work hard, and put in a good effort you WILL pass. I repeat, If you do your work, and work hard, and put in a good effort you WILL pass. Again, great guy, I learned a lot about fluids, and he's a must-take for engrs

Great professor. He will keep you interested in the topic. He is really funny and really helpful. He has no problem catering to the dumbest person in the class and helping them to understand. Tests are hard... But its an engineering class. He is more than reasonable when it comes to grading. Awesome prof, I will be taking him for fluids.

If you have a chance to take him please take him. Kuemmerele keeps its interesting and test are reasonable. He is funny, realistic and a transient professor. Work had and you will get a good grade. highly enjoyed class  one of my fav professor at spsu.
